titleStmt.title: John Quincy Adams Diary Digital Project

div.p: 1. V:30. Monday: Boston— Quincy— Creek Bath.

list.item: Boston after breakfast with Charles by West-Cambridge
Visits to Mrs. Humphreys—to Mrs S. A. Otis—and Mrs J. P. Hall and Isaac Smith—
At Dr Welsh’s, found George and Mr Frye— John Kirke and the Carriage came at Noon
Mr Frye came with me to Quincy— Weather intensely warm.
John still unwell—

list.head: Visitors after dinner
list.item: Hull— Revd Mr of New-Orleans
Sherman— Mr from Utica New-York with his wife and two daughters.
Bath and Swim at the wharf with J. Q. A. jr.

div.p: 2. V:30. Swim— Railway— Neponset Directors dinner.

list.item: Swam at the wharf—with my brother and his Sons J. Q. and Jos. H.
Swam from wharf to wharf.
Ride with my brother and Mr Frye to the Railway— Went to the top of Coll Perkins’s Tower— Visited also the Bunker Hill Ledge
Pickman Coll from Boston.
Johnson— Comfort H from Dedham with his wife Son and daughter—
His present of two Melons.
Dined with my brother at Dorchester with the Directors of Neponset Bridge— Bass Josiah Beale— G. W. Foster James, Greenleaf Thomas, Head Joseph— Miller Edward. Quincy Josiah Wailes—
Elizabeth C. Charles and T. B. Adams jr. came out from Boston— Rain.

div.p: 3. 11:30. and VII. Wednesday— Fishing party failed—

list.item: Davis— from Fairlie Vermont— Antimasonic— Crary’s speech—
Beale G. W. dined with us.
Mr Frye left us and went to Boston. John and T. B. A. jr with him

list.head:
Affairs of Mr Boylston—
Power of Exors. to Genl Towne

list.item: John and T. B. Adams jr returned late from Boston.

div.p: 4— III:15— Thursday— Water party
From Bent’s point Bridge, in the Hingham Packet— Brilliant

From the point, sailed at 9:45 A.M. at 10:45 precisely one hour past the Boston Light house and point Alderton—went out 3 or 4. miles— Heavy wind and Sea. no fishing—returned into the Harbour—from the Light-house to Boston below long wharf 1. hour—beat the Revenue Cutter.

G. W. Beale and Leml. Bracket went ashore with Ammidon and Gourgas—brought from the market 3. Cod— Beat down in an hour and a half to under the lee of Moon Island— There at Anchor we dined— I went ashore with G. W. Beale and J Whitney. Returned on board, dined—at 1/2 past 4 P.M. sailed and in an hour and a half beat up to Bent’s point.
Partly walked home: met the Carriages going to the point for us
I rode with Mrs. Greenleaf who took me home—about Sunset
Found G. W. and C. F. Adams out from Boston.

The passengers— The party consisted of
T. B. Adams— John Adams, Ammidon Captn. Josiah Bass, G. W. Beale, and his Son George, Lemuel Bracket— Gourgas Thomas Greenleaf Daniel Greenleaf, Edward Miller, Dr. T. Phipps, Sampson, W. Smith, Captain Souther, Captain John Whitney.
5. V:45. Friday

list.item: Waite, Daniel.— Light-House. Nayatt Point. R.I
Rawson— Joseph Do
His Son—
Poland— Benajah one-armed— Buenos-Ayres service
Went to Boston with John and T. B. Adams jr.
French Theatre— Le Procès du Fandango et le Barbier de Seville— Musique de Rossini

div.p: 6. VII— Saturday— Bath at Swimming School— Quincy

list.item: Parkman— George
Thacher— Peter.
Lieber— Dr
Crowell—
Loring. of Hingham
Louisa Smith
Susan Harrod

div.p: Dr Parkman, and the Monument to Harvard
With Dr Lieber and Judge Thacher to the Swimming School, where I took a Sea-Bath— Visited the Gymnastic Establishment at the Washington Gardens— They are going out of use—
Rode with John and T. B. Adams junr to Quincy before dinner.
Louisa C. Smith and Miss Harrod dined with us.

Mr Crowell came after dinner to urge the discharge from prison of Benjamin Winslow—wishes me to see G. Blake— Mr Loring invited me to breakfast next Thursday at E. Gay’s— Hingham— For a party at the Cohassett Rocks.
7. VI. Sunday.

list.item: Heard Mr Whitney— John 5.25.— Luke 23:46.
G. W. A. came out from Boston— Letter from L. C. A
Degrand P. P. F— passes the Night here—

div.p: 8. V:30. Monday.— Walpole—

Degrand returned to Boston in the Stage— With T. B. Adams jr. I planted in my nursery, peach, plum and cherry stones and a few fine tree Apple, pear and grape seeds— I filled the rows in the beds next to G. W. Beale’s ground, where some of the last year’s plantation are up— Of which there are Oaks—English and indigenous Peaches, Plums, Apricots, Cherries, Mazzard, Red heart and wild, Apples, Pears and Catalpa’s— On the other side are a few Cork Oaks, two Spanish Chesnut’s— Black Oaks and apples— I planted now there one row of gold Cloth plum stones 12.
Summer House Cellar— Oaks— Walnuts— Peaches, Horse Plums— Elms.
G. W. Adams and John Adams came out from Boston at noon, with a Letter from Mrs C. M. F. Smith to me of 3. Septr. my wife severely ill

I left Quincy at 3:30. P.M—on horseback— John Kirke with the Phaeton and pair we came through Dedham and at 7. alighted at Fuller’s Tavern Walpole— Found there Mrs Appleton of Baltimore, H. Dawes and and Hannah Elliot
George and John went to Boston— John to join me at Providence tomorrow.
9. V. Tuesday— Providence— Long Island Sound

list.item: Breakfasted with Mrs Appleton and her party.
Left Fullers at 7. A.M. with rain—missed the way—reached Providence at 10:15— Stop’d at Franklin house— Numerous visitors— Genl Barton— Moses Brown 93— Govr Earle &c.
Steam Boat Chancellor Livingston Captain Coggeshall, left Providence at Noon— John arrived in the Stage from Boston
North East, cold wind, and rain. 160. Passengers
Newport at 2:30. P.M. Mr and Mrs Andrew Stevenson.
Genl Bernard— Captain Poussin came on board at Newport
Wheeler the painter and family at Providence— Passed inside of Fisher’s Island between Sunset and dark— Passed Falkner’s Island light at 9 P.M.

div.p: 10. V:15. New-York— Elizabeth Town— Brunswick.

list.item: Landed at New-York at 6. A.M— City Hotel, breakfasted.
S. Blunt, C. King, G. Sullivan.

Sent for Jonathan Thompson the Collector— Requested him to admit free the baggage of Genl. Verveer coming in the Packet of 1. August from Havre—charged with a mission from the king of the Netherlands to open the passage at the Isthmus of Darien— He spoke of de Bresson’s arrival and another of the Revenue— 2. first quarters 8 Millions.
Walk with C. King in Castle Garden and on the Battery. Cactus Night-blooming Cereus. Post-Office— T. Bailey died the 6th
James Monroe (S. L. Gouverneur) A. Gallatin— A. Gracie.
Steam-boat to Elizabeth-Town 10:30. G. Sullivan with us. Dr. Hosack in the boat— His medical opinions— Cutaneous diseases
Landed at Noon— Rode my horse to New-Brunswick 18 Miles.

Arrived at 3:30. Stop’d at City-Hotel— Follett’s— From immediately after dinner till 9. P.M. a continual stream of visitors Coll. Southard, Mr Kirkpatrick, Judge M’Chesney, Court and Bar— Clergy and others.

div.p: 11. V:30. Thursday— From New-Brunswick to Philadelphia—

list.item: Left New-Brunswick at 7. A.M. after Breakfast— Straight Turnpike

Rode to Trenton 25. Miles— Williamsburg— Temple’s Tavern; left side of the road—opposition Tavern the other side— Reached Trenton at Noon— Rode 6 Miles further to the landing— Steam-boat Trenton left the landing at 1/2 past two—landed at Philadelphia at 5. Mr and Mrs Gilmor of Baltimore and James Craig passengers— J. Connell came to the Boat, and went with me to Head’s Mansion House Hotel.
J. Sergeant—went with him and spent the Evening at his house
Mrs Rawle jr. and Mrs. Alsop— Josiah S. Johnston, Josiah Randall, and Edward Ingersoll— Returned to Head’s at 10. P.M.— John Vaughan and R. Walsh.

div.p: 12 IV:30 Friday. From Philadelphia to Baltimore.

Steamboat to Newcastle at 5. A.M. Saw Venus after Sunrise— R. H. Wilde a passenger— Reached Newcastle at 8:30. Rode my horse to Frenchtown—arrived at 11:30—a quarter of an hour before the Stages— Steam boat Philadelphia Captain left Frenchtown at Noon—landed at Baltimore at Sunset. Mr Newman, and T. Finley the Marshall came on board the boat. A great opposition Meeting— Anniversary of the landing of the British at North-point in 1814— As we arrived they were firing the Salute of Sunset upon the Hill— I came to lodge at Barnum’s City Hotel— From the moment of my arrival, there was a constant succession of visitors till near 11. P.M. Among them all the delegates from the Administration ward meetings— These delegations having this Evening met, and agreed upon Luke Tiernan and Mr Richardson as their Candidates to represent the City of Baltimore in the State Legislature— Mr Newman informed me, that he had heard yesterday from Washington, and that my wife’s health was much improved—
13. VI. Saturday— Baltimore to Washington—

Left Barnum’s Hotel at 7. A.M—rode my horse to Merrill’s tavern, Waterloo— There Breakfasted— Rode in the Carriage to De Graeff’s tavern. Rossburg—15. Miles— Then my horse again to Washington where we arrived safe at 4. P.M. Found my wife convalescent though still confined to her chamber— At Drummond’s tavern where we stopped to water the horses was a county-meeting— B. Forrest and J. C. Weemswere there— Mr and Mrs W. S. Smith, my Son John’s wife and Abigail S. Adams we found well— Johnson Hellen dined with us— Mr Rush and Dr. Huntt were here this Evening— D. G.
14. V:30. Sunday.

list.item: Heard at St. John’s Church Mr Hawley, A.M. Psalms 119.155
P.M.— Isaiah. 11.10. Mr Frye here.
My Son Charles arrived from Boston— Day of repose

div.p: 15. V:30. Monday.

list.item: Graham George— Letter from Govr of Ohio. Suspend Land Sales
Brent— Daniel— Betsey Hawley— Lawrence— Torlade
Nourse— C. J— Cherokee Indian land— Armstrongs Rep
Rush— Richard— Canal Reports— Genl. Verveer
Macomb Alexander— Court martials Boardman and Smith
Watkins, Tobias— Letter from Ralph Lockwood

div.p: 16. V:30. Mr and Mrs Frye, and Tom to dine

list.item: Brent. Daniel— Draft from Brents— Despatch from A. H. Everett
Huygens— Chevr.— His Letters from Valck— Verveer— the Arbitration
Fendall— Philip R. Blake’s Letter to his brother
M’lean John— Post-Office New-York— Recommendations

list.head: asks discharge of his Son from Navy.
list.item: Fullerton.
John’s of Chambersburg.
Waters Revd. Dr. Francis— Letter from L. D. Teackle
Cranch— William.
signed 100 Blank Patents.

div.p: 17. V:30. Wednesday— Walk over Tiber

list.item: Rush. Richard—
Seymour with Letter to M. S. C. Clarke
Wilson— Robert for lighthouse Recomn. from L. Tiernan & M’Kim
Roberdeau Isaac. from Bedford Springs.

div.p: 18. V:30. Ride alone. symbols Trimmed wild Cherry tree

list.item: Tharp— William, a Letter.

row.cell: P. H. by the back Street

list.item: signed 17. Land-grants.
Order on Petition of Hawson Hick, Master of the British Brig Unity, from Rye to New-York for remission of penalty for excess of ten passengers.
Let the penalty be remitted on payment of Costs.

div.p: 19. V:30. Friday. Ride. Navy-yard. Bridge & Turnpike 10. symbols

list.item: Holbrook— Secy of War
Longworth of Cincinnati
Nourse— Ch. J. with Winebago Treaty
Forsyth— James of N.C. to be Lieutt. Marine Corps
Velez Alesandro ex-charge d’Affaires from Colombia—

Deed from George Cicott a Potawatami Chief to Chauncey Carter of one Section of Land at the Falls of Eel river—by Treaty of 16. Octr. 1826.
I consent to the above conveyance.
Rush— Richard— Canal Meeting— Payment of Public Debt
Medina. Colombian Affairs— Peru— Bolivar.
Laurie Revd. Liberian Colonial Agency— R. Randall
Hay Charles— Same Subject— Letter from Mr Southard—

div.p: 20. VI. Ride— symbols Kalorama— S. H. S— Back-road

list.item: Appleton Charles H— Appointment— Missed
Brent— W. L— of Louisiana introduces
Hopkins.
Wilson— John— His claim, and application for appointment—denied
Rush— Richard— Canal basin settled— Wilson’s claims— Revenue

Brent. Daniel— Torlade to wait new Credentials— R. Forrest ill
Letter of 12 instt. from Mr Clay
Hay Charles. Instructions to R. Randall— Agent at Liberia
Shaff— William Revolutionary Soldier— West of New-York
Semmes— Old Mulatto woman— Cook to former Presidents

div.p: 21. VI. Sunday

list.item:
Heard Mr Hawley— 16. Sunday after Trinity. Luke 13–24
Proverbs. 2–1–6.
Hay— Charles— Buenos-Ayrean Ships— Order to Como. Chauncey

div.p:
22. V:45. Ride Capitol. S. H. S— Col: College. Red Oak Acorns
Chesnuts

list.item: Conner. Benjamin— Filling Potomack Channel

Brent Daniel— bes. despatch from Lawrence— Rebello’s protest. Brents dept.
Port. Cortes Order to remit penalty on payment of Costs to Genest Jombert, master of the French Ship L’Esperance, from Havre to N. York for excess of 12 passengers.
Baty of Ohio
Munro Thomas.

Graham George— Letter from S. L. Gouverneur— Genl. Porter.
Baty’s Claim compensation for Toll-Bridge

Oaks— Black— White— Red— Post Spanish, Chesnut, Willow, Pin.
Black-Jack.

div.p: 23. IV:30. Tuesday— Lamplight. Ride symbols

list.item: Nourse— C. J— for Report of West-Point visitors— Sent to the Dept. 4 symbols
Nourse Joseph— visit
Barrell— J. J. Same
Mason John do
Gordon— N. N. of Mobile
Hamilton— James. Certificates R. Rush and Jos. Anderson
Lovell— Joseph— G. B. English’s papers. he died the 21st.

Knapp Samuel— Chief Clerk Treasr. U.S. Consulate— Secy Legation
to publish his Lectures in England. Graham’s Hist. U.S.

div.p: 24. V. Wednesday— Ride alone. Oak and Hickory from one trunk.

list.item: Rhea Mrs. pardon for her husband—disorderly house
Woodward Mrs—with infant
Hagner Peter— Excursion—to put his Son to College
Hay— George— came from Loudon with Mrs Gouverneur

list.head: Visitors
list.item: Lively of Hampton
His Son.
Colton. of Ex. Council— Va

Rush— R— Rev: Cutter. M. Conner Lieutt— Letter from Collr Rochester
Letter to Collr. N.Y. Verveer.— M. Dot—
Macomb. Alexr. Mutiny Act— Civil witnesses in Court Martials
Legaré Copies of his Court Martial proceedings.
Watkins Tobias— Unitarianism— Renton’s
Brent— Daniel— Letters and despatches from Jas. Brown.

div.p: 25. V:30. Ride alone— Thursday —

list.item: Little to borrow money
Nourse C. J. Deed Rebecca Hackley to Hugh Hanna— 18. July 1828. 1/2 Section of Land, reserved by Treaty with Miami Indians of 23. Octr. 1828.
I consent to the written conveyance
Petn. of Delaware chiefs to remove West of Missi
Petn. Van Meter &c to Sell Lands reserved. By Treaty with Miamis 29. Septr 1827.
Crowell— John— Creek Indian balance purchase of reserves.
Atty Genls. opinion.
Webb. James— place

Rush— Richard— for John Wilson’s papers— Wine for Netherlands
Charge d’Affaires, Mexico, at New-York

div.p: 26. VI. Friday— Rain— Georgetown heights

list.item: Tyler B. O. Going to Georgia—from Harrisburg— Scholtze
Mason John— for Gouverneur P.M. at New-York
Harrison— W. H— from Cincinnati—going to Colombia.
Rush. Richard— Tariff Letters to Collr. at Rochester, & Consuls in England
Hay— George.

div.p: 27. VI:15— Saturday — Ride on poney, alone met symbols

list.item: O’Sullivan Mrs Barbara— 5. Returned her manuscript
Barrell. S— B— Letter from his Cousin, Consul at Malaga— Greece
Hay— George. Conversation upon religion and superstition
Rush. Richard— To pay 4 Millions next 31. Decr
Hay Charles— Letter from S. L. S.— to send Clerk Homans
Brent Daniel. Letter from James Barbour— Liverpool 22. Augt
Scott of N. Brunswick N.J—a visit

list.head: Visits
list.item: Curry.
Duponceau Stephen—with his Grand-daughter from Philadelphia.
Cheseborough of New-York— A visitor.

div.p: 28— V:30. Short ride— Kalorama—and foot of College-Hill

list.item: Heard Mr Hawley P.M. 17th. after Trinity— Isaiah 30–26
Johnson Hellen dined here— Thunder Shower—
Letters to Josiah Quincy and G. W. Adams.
Missed Church A.M.

div.p: 29 IV:30. Monday— Ride, back of S. H. Smith’s

list.item: Bomford— George— Advises to sell the lead-mines

list.head: visits
list.item: Earle— judge E. S. Maryland
His two daughters.
Another
Thomas Coll. symbols from Holten Plantation Maine

list.head:
company to dine
Abissin spoke of Ely of Rochester appointed by mistake to a Consular Office, already full— He wants another Appointmt.
Spoke of Sunday travelling.

list.item: Abissin— of Rochester. N.Y.

div.p: 30. III:45. Ride to Spring tavern

list.item: Hay George to take leave

list.head: from Fredericsburg— Mr Clay at Judge Brook’s—near there.
list.item: Robertson— of Va

list.head: Military Station at Jefferson Barracks sickly— Wishes to see Secy of War.

list.item: Brent— Daniel— Letters from King of the Netherlands—from Mr Clay—from Consul T. Aspinwall and Captain Delano— Refusal to bring home destitute Seamen— Suit to be discontinued.
Phillips. S. C. Salem.
Miller: E. S. Maryd.
Addison of Geotn Orders to appoint keepers of Light-Houses.

25 William S. Moore. Nobsque Point Mass.
